name: Options
description: Class to set options on generating chart.- It's instantiated internally, not exposed for public.

name: Options
see: {@link bb.generate} to use these options on generating the chart

name: bindto
description:
bindto The CSS selector or the element which the chart will be set to. D3 selection object can be specified. If other chart is set already, it will be replaced with the new one (only one chart can be set in one element).

If this option is not specified, the chart will be generated but not be set. Instead, we can access the element by chart.element and set it by ourselves.
- **NOTE:** > When chart is not binded, bb starts observing if chart.element is binded by MutationObserver. > In this case, polyfill is required in IE9 and IE10 becuase they do not support MutationObserver. > On the other hand, if chart always will be binded, polyfill will not be required because MutationObserver will never be called.
examples: bindto: "#myContainer"// or elementbindto: document.getElementById("myContainer")// or D3 selection objectbindto: d3.select("#myContainer")

name: svg
description: Set svg element's class name

properties.description: class name for svg element
properties.name: svg.classname

name: size
description: The desired size of the chart element.If value is not specified, the width of the chart will be calculated by the size of the parent element it's appended to.

properties.description: width of the chart element
properties.name: size.width

properties.description: height of the chart element
properties.name: size.height

name: padding
description: The padding of the chart element.

properties.description: padding on the top of chart
properties.name: padding.top

properties.description: padding on the right of chart
properties.name: padding.right

properties.description: padding on the bottom of chart
properties.name: padding.bottom

properties.description: padding on the left of chart
properties.name: padding.left

name: resize
description: Set chart resize options

properties.description: Set chart resize automatically on viewport changes.
properties.name: resize.auto

name: zoom
description: Set zoom options
examples: zoom: {     enabled: true,     rescale: true,     extent: [1, 100]  // enable more zooming     onzoom: function(domain) { ... },     onzoomstart: function(event) { ... },     onzoomend: function(domain) { ... } }

properties.description: Enable zooming.
properties.name: zoom.enabled

properties.description:
Enable to rescale after zooming.
If true set, y domain will be updated according to the zoomed region.
properties.name: zoom.rescale

properties.description: Change zoom extent.
properties.name: zoom.extent

properties.description:
Set callback that is called when the chart is zooming.
Specified function receives the zoomed domain.
properties.name: zoom.onzoom

properties.description:
Set callback that is called when zooming starts.
Specified function receives the zoom event.
properties.name: zoom.onzoomstart

properties.description:
Set callback that is called when zooming ends.
Specified function receives the zoomed domain.
properties.name: zoom.onzoomend

name: interaction
description: Interaction options
examples: interaction: {   enabled: false,   inputType: {       mouse: true,       touch: false   }}

properties.description:
Indicate if the chart should have interactions.
If `false` is set, all of interactions (showing/hiding tooltip, selection, mouse events, etc) will be disabled.
properties.name: interaction.enabled

properties.description: enable or disable mouse interaction
properties.name: interaction.inputType.mouse

properties.description: enable or disable  touch interaction
properties.name: interaction.inputType.touch

name: onover
description: Set a callback to execute when mouse/touch enters the chart.

name: onout
description: Set a callback to execute when mouse/touch leaves the chart.

name: onresize
description: Set a callback to execute when user resizes the screen.

name: onresized
description: SSet a callback to execute when screen resize finished.

name: oninit
description: Set a callback to execute when the chart is initialized.

name: onrendered
description: Set a callback which is executed when the chart is rendered. Basically, this callback will be called in each time when the chart is redrawed.

name: transition
description:
Set duration of transition (in milliseconds) for chart animation.

- **NOTE:** If `0 `or `null` set, transition will be skipped. So, this makes initial rendering faster especially in case you have a lot of data.

properties.description: duration in milliseconds
properties.name: transition.duration

name: data:x
description:
Specify the key of x values in the data.

We can show the data with non-index x values by this option. This option is required when the type of x axis is timeseries. If this option is set on category axis, the values of the data on the key will be used for category names.

name: data:xs
description:
Specify the keys of the x values for each data.

This option can be used if we want to show the data that has different x values.

name: data:xFormat
description: Set a format to parse string specifed as x.

name: data:xLocaltime
description: Set localtime format to parse x axis.

name: data:xSort
description: Sort on x axis.

name: data:names
description: Set custom data name.
examples: data: {  names: {    data1: "Data Name 1",    data2: "Data Name 2"  }}

name: data:classes
description:
Set custom data class.

If this option is specified, the element g for the data has an additional class that has the prefix 'bb-target-' (eg. bb-target-additional-data1-class).

name: data:groups
description: Set groups for the data for stacking.

name: data:axes
description: Set y axis the data related to. y and y2 can be used.

name: data:type
description:
Set chart type at once.

If this option is specified, the type will be applied to every data. This setting can be overwritten by data.types.

**Available Values:** - line - spline - step - area - area-spline - area-step - bar - scatter - pie - donut - gauge

name: data:types
description:
Set chart type for each data.
This setting overwrites data.type setting.

name: data:labels:format
description:
Set formatter function for data labels.
The formatter function receives 4 arguments such as v, id, i, j and it must return a string that will be shown as the label. The arguments are:
- `v` is the value of the data point where the label is shown. - `id` is the id of the data where the label is shown. - `i` is the index of the data point where the label is shown. - `j` is the sub index of the data point where the label is shown.

Formatter function can be defined for each data by specifying as an object and D3 formatter function can be set (ex. d3.format('$'))
examples: data: {  labels: {    format: function(v, id, i, j) { ... }    // it's possible to set for each data    //format: {    //    data1: function(v, id, i, j) { ... },    //    ...    //}  }}

name: data:labels
description: Show labels on each data points.

name: data:order
description:
This option changes the order of stacking the data and pieces of pie/donut. If `null` specified, it will be the order the data loaded. If function specified, it will be used to sort the data and it will recieve the data as argument.

**Available Values:** - desc - asc - function(data1, data2) { ... } - null

name: data:regions
description:
Define regions for each data.

The values must be an array for each data and it should include an object that has start, end, style. If start is not set, the start will be the first data point. If end is not set, the end will be the last data point.
Currently this option supports only line chart and dashed style. If this option specified, the line will be dashed only in the regions.

name: data:color
description:
Set color converter function.

This option should a function and the specified function receives color (e.g. '#ff0000') and d that has data parameters like id, value, index, etc. And it must return a string that represents color (e.g. '#00ff00').

name: data:colors
description: Set color for each data.

name: data:hide
description:
Hide each data when the chart appears.

If true specified, all of data will be hidden. If multiple ids specified as an array, those will be hidden.
examples: data: {  // all of data will be hidden  hide: true  // specified data will be hidden  hide: ["data1", ...]}

name: data:selection:enabled
description:
Set data selection enabled.

If this option is set true, we can select the data points and get/set its state of selection by API (e.g. select, unselect, selected).

name: data:selection:grouped
description:
Set grouped selection enabled.

If this option set true, multiple data points that have same x value will be selected by one selection.

name: data:selection:isselectable
description:
Set a callback for each data point to determine if it's selectable or not.

The callback will receive d as an argument and it has some parameters like id, value, index. This callback should return boolean.

name: data:selection:multiple
description:
Set multiple data points selection enabled.

If this option set true, multile data points can have the selected state at the same time. If false set, only one data point can have the selected state and the others will be unselected when the new data point is selected.

name: data:selection:draggable
description:
Enable to select data points by dragging.

If this option set true, data points can be selected by dragging. **NOTE:** If this option set true, scrolling on the chart will be disabled because dragging event will handle the event.

name: data:onclick
description:
Set a callback for click event on each data point.

This callback will be called when each data point clicked and will receive d and element as the arguments. d is the data clicked and element is the element clicked. In this callback, this will be the Chart object.

name: data:onover
description:
Set a callback for mouse/touch over event on each data point.

This callback will be called when mouse cursor or via touch moves onto each data point and will receive d as the argument. d is the data where mouse cursor moves onto. In this callback, this will be the Chart object.

name: data:onout
description:
Set a callback for mouse/touch out event on each data point.

This callback will be called when mouse cursor or via touch moves out each data point and will receive d as the argument. d is the data where mouse cursor moves out. In this callback, this will be the Chart object.

name: data:onselected
description: Set a callback for on data selection.

name: data:onunselected
description: Set a callback for on data un-selection.

name: data:url
description: Load a CSV or JSON file from a URL. NOTE that this will not work if loading via the "file://" protocol as the most browsers will block XMLHTTPRequests.

name: data:json
description: Parse a JSON object for data. See also data.keys.
examples: data: {    json: [      {name: "www.site1.com", upload: 200, download: 200, total: 400},      {name: "www.site2.com", upload: 100, download: 300, total: 400},      {name: "www.site3.com", upload: 300, download: 200, total: 500},      {name: "www.site4.com", upload: 400, download: 100, total: 500}    ],    keys: {      // x: "name", // it's possible to specify 'x' when category axis      value: ["upload", "download"]    }}

name: data:rows
description: Load data from a multidimensional array, with the first element containing the data names, the following containing related data in that order.

name: data:columns
description: Load data from a multidimensional array, with each element containing an array consisting of a datum name and associated data values.

name: data:mimeType
description: Used if loading JSON via data.url.

name: data:keys
description: Choose which JSON object keys correspond to desired data.
examples: data: {    json: [      {name: "www.site1.com", upload: 200, download: 200, total: 400},      {name: "www.site2.com", upload: 100, download: 300, total: 400},      {name: "www.site3.com", upload: 300, download: 200, total: 500},      {name: "www.site4.com", upload: 400, download: 100, total: 500}    ],    keys: {      // x: "name", // it's possible to specify 'x' when category axis      value: ["upload", "download"]    }}

name: data:empty:label:text
description: Set text displayed when empty data.

name: subchart
description: Set subchart options
examples: subchart: {     show: true,     size: {         height: 20     },     onbrush: function(domain) { ... } }

properties.description: Show sub chart on the bottom of the chart.
properties.name: subchart.show

properties.description: Change the height of the subchart.
properties.name: subchart.size.height

properties.description:
Set callback for brush event.
Specified function receives the current zoomed x domain.
properties.name: subchart.onbrush

name: color
description: Set color of the data values

properties.description: custom color pattern
properties.name: color.pattern

properties.description: color threshold
properties.name: color.threshold

properties.description: unit
properties.name: color.threshold.unit

properties.description: value
properties.name: color.threshold.value

properties.description: max value
properties.name: color.threshold.max

name: legend
description: Legend options
examples: legend: {     show: true,     hide: true,     //or hide: "data1"     //or hide: ["data1", "data2"]     position: "bottom",  // bottom, right, inset     inset: {         anchor: "top-right"  // top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right         x: 20,         y: 10,         step: 2     },     onclick: function(id) { ... },     onover: function(id) { ... },     onout: function(id) { ... } }

properties.description: Show or hide legend.
properties.name: legend.show

properties.description: Hide legend If true given, all legend will be hidden. If string or array given, only the legend that has the id will be hidden.
properties.name: legend.hide

properties.description:
Change the position of legend.
Available values are: `bottom`, `right` and `inset` are supported.
properties.name: legend.position

properties.description:
Change inset legend attributes.
This option accepts object that has the keys anchor, x, y and step. anchor decides the position of the legend. These anchors are available: - top-left - top-right - bottom-left - bottom-right x and y set the position of the legend based on the anchor.
step defines the max step the lagend has (e.g. If 2 set and legend has 3 legend item, the legend 2 columns).
properties.name: legend.inset

properties.description: Set click event handler to the legend item.
properties.name: legend.item.onclick

properties.description: Set mouse/touch over event handler to the legend item.
properties.name: legend.item.onover

properties.description: Set mouse/touch out event handler to the legend item.
properties.name: legend.item.onout

name: axis:rotated
description: Switch x and y axis position.

name: axis:x:show
description: Show or hide x axis.

name: axis:x:type
description:
Set type of x axis.

**Available Values:** - timeseries - category - indexed

name: axis:x:localtime
description:
Set how to treat the timezone of x values.
If true, treat x value as localtime. If false, convert to UTC internally.

name: axis:x:categories
description: Set category names on category axis.This must be an array that includes category names in string. If category names are included in the date by data.x option, this is not required.

name: axis:x:tick:centered
description: Centerise ticks on category axis.

name: axis:x:tick:format
description: A function to format tick value. Format string is also available for timeseries data.
examples: axis: {  x: {    tick: {      format: function(x) {          return x.getFullYear();      }    }  }}

name: axis:x:tick:culling
description:
Setting for culling ticks.

If true is set, the ticks will be culled, then only limitted tick text will be shown. This option does not hide the tick lines. If false is set, all of ticks will be shown.

We can change the number of ticks to be shown by axis.x.tick.culling.max.
defaultvalue: - true for indexed axis and timeseries axis- false for category axis

name: axis:x:tick:culling:max
description: The number of tick texts will be adjusted to less than this value.

name: axis:x:tick:count
description:
The number of x axis ticks to show.

This option hides tick lines together with tick text. If this option is used on timeseries axis, the ticks position will be determined precisely and not nicely positioned (e.g. it will have rough second value).

name: axis:x:tick:fit
description:
Fit x axis ticks.

If true set, the ticks will be positioned nicely. If false set, the ticks will be positioned according to x value of the data points.

name: axis:x:tick:values
description:
Set the x values of ticks manually.

If this option is provided, the position of the ticks will be determined based on those values. This option works with timeseries data and the x values will be parsed accoding to the type of the value and data.xFormat option.

name: axis:x:tick:rotate
description:
Rotate x axis tick text.
If you set negative value, it will rotate to opposite direction.

name: axis:x:tick:outer
description: Show x axis outer tick.

name: axis:x:tick:multiline
description: Set tick text to be multiline

name: axis:x:tick:width
description: Set tick width

name: axis:x:max
description: Set max value of x axis range.

name: axis:x:min
description: Set min value of x axis range.

name: axis:x:padding
description:
Set padding for x axis.

If this option is set, the range of x axis will increase/decrease according to the values. If no padding is needed in the rage of x axis, 0 should be set. - **NOTE:** The padding values aren't based on pixels. It differs according axis types
- **category:** The unit of tick value ex. the given value `1`, is same as the width of 1 tick width - **timeseries:** Numeric time value ex. the given value `1000*60*60*24`, which is numeric time equivalent of a day, is same as the width of 1 tick width
examples: axis: {  x: {    padding: {      // when axis type is 'category'      left: 1,  // set left padding width of equivalent value of a tick's width      right: 0.5  // set right padding width as half of equivalent value of tick's width      // when axis type is 'timeseries'      left: 1000*60*60*24,  // set left padding width of equivalent value of a day tick's width      right: 1000*60*60*12   // set right padding width as half of equivalent value of a day tick's width    }  }}

name: axis:x:height
description:
Set height of x axis.

The height of x axis can be set manually by this option. If you need more space for x axis, please use this option for that. The unit is pixel.

name: axis:x:extent
description: Set default extent for subchart and zoom. This can be an array or function that returns an array.
examples: axis: {  x: {    // [[x0, y0], [x1, y1]], where [x0, y0] is the top-left corner and [x1, y1] is the bottom-right corner    // https://github.com/d3/d3-brush/blob/master/src/brush.js#L521    extent: [[0, 0], [200, 60]]  }}

name: axis:x:label
description:
Set label on x axis.

You can set x axis label and change its position by this option. string and object can be passed and we can change the poisiton by passing object that has position key. Available position differs according to the axis direction (vertical or horizontal). If string set, the position will be the default. - If it's horizontal axis: - inner-right [default] - inner-center - inner-left - outer-right - outer-center - outer-left - If it's vertical axis: - inner-top [default] - inner-middle - inner-bottom - outer-top - outer-middle - outer-bottom
examples: axis: {  x: {    label: "Your X Axis"  }}axis: {  x: {    label: {       text: "Your X Axis",       position: "outer-center"    }  }}

name: axis:y:show
description: Show or hide y axis.

name: axis:y:type
description:
Set type of y axis.

**Available Values:** - timeseries - category - indexed

name: axis:y:max
description: Set max value of y axis.- **NOTE:** Padding will be added based on this value, so if you don't need the padding, please set axis.y.padding to disable it (e.g. axis.y.padding = 0).

name: axis:y:min
description: Set min value of y axis.- **NOTE:**  Padding will be added based on this value, so if you don't need the padding, please set axis.y.padding to disable it (e.g. axis.y.padding = 0).

name: axis:y:inverted
description:
Change the direction of y axis.

If true set, the direction will be from the top to the bottom.

name: axis:y:center
description: Set center value of y axis.

name: axis:y:inner
description: Show y axis inside of the chart.

name: axis:y:label
description:
Set label on y axis.

You can set y axis label and change its position by this option. This option works in the same way as axis.x.label.
examples: axis: {  y: {    label: "Your Y Axis"  }}axis: {  y: {    label: {       text: "Your Y Axis",       position: "outer-middle"    }  }}

name: axis:y:format
description:
Set formatter for y axis tick text.

This option accepts d3.format object as well as a function you define.
examples: axis: {  x: {    tick: {      format: function(x) {          return x.getFullYear();      }    }  }}

name: axis:y:tick:outer
description: Show y axis outer tick.

name: axis:y:tick:values
description: Set y axis tick values manually.

name: axis:y:tick:count
description:
Set the number of y axis ticks.

- **NOTE:** The position of the ticks will be calculated precisely, so the values on the ticks will not be rounded nicely. In the case, axis.y.tick.format or axis.y.tick.values will be helpful.

name: axis:y:tick:time
description:
Set the number of y axis ticks.

**NOTE:** The position of the ticks will be calculated precisely, so the values on the ticks will not be rounded nicely. In the case, axis.y.tick.format or axis.y.tick.values will be helpful.
examples: axis: {  y: {    tick: {      time: {         // ticks at 15-minute intervals         // https://github.com/d3/d3-scale/blob/master/README.md#time_ticks         value: d3.timeMinute.every(15)      }    }  }}

properties.description: D3's time interval function (https://github.com/d3/d3-time#intervals)
properties.name: time.value

name: axis:y:padding
description:
Set padding for y axis.

You can set padding for y axis to create more space on the edge of the axis. This option accepts object and it can include top and bottom. top, bottom will be treated as pixels.

name: axis:y:default
description:
Set default range of y axis.

This option set the default value for y axis when there is no data on init.

name: axis:y2:show
description: Show or hide y2 axis.

name: axis:y2:max
description: Set max value of y2 axis.

name: axis:y2:min
description: Set min value of y2 axis.

name: axis:y2:inverted
description:
Change the direction of y2 axis.

If true set, the direction will be from the top to the bottom.

name: axis:y2:center
description: Set center value of y2 axis.

name: axis:y2:inner
description: Show y2 axis inside of the chart.

name: axis:y2:label
description:
Set label on y2 axis.

You can set y2 axis label and change its position by this option. This option works in the same way as axis.x.label.
examples: axis: {  y2: {    label: "Your Y2 Axis"  }}axis: {  y2: {    label: {       text: "Your Y2 Axis",       position: "outer-middle"    }  }}

name: axis:y2:tick:format
description:
Set formatter for y2 axis tick text.

This option works in the same way as axis.y.format.
examples: axis: {  y2: {    tick: {      format: d3.format("$,")      //or format: function(d) { return "$" + d; }    }  }}

name: axis:y2:tick:outer
description: Show or hide y2 axis outer tick.

name: axis:y2:tick:values
description: Set y2 axis tick values manually.

name: axis:y2:tick:count
description: Set the number of y2 axis ticks.- **NOTE:** This works in the same way as axis.y.tick.count.

name: axis:y2:padding
description: Set the number of y2 axis ticks.- **NOTE:** This works in the same way as axis.y.tick.count.

name: axis:y2:default
description:
Set default range of y2 axis.

This option set the default value for y2 axis when there is no data on init.

name: grid
description: Set related options
examples: grid: {  x: {    show: true,    lines: [      {value: 2, text: "Label on 2"},      {value: 5, text: "Label on 5", class: "label-5"}      {value: 6, text: "Label on 6", position: "start"}    ]  },	 y: {    show: true,    lines: [      {value: 100, text: "Label on 100"},      {value: 200, text: "Label on 200", class: "label-200"}      {value: 300, text: "Label on 300", position: 'middle'}    ],    ticks: 5  },  focus: {     show: false  },  lines: {     front: false  }}

properties.description: Show grids along x axis.
properties.name: x.show

properties.description:
Show additional grid lines along x axis.
This option accepts array including object that has value, text, position and class. text, position and class are optional. For position, start, middle and end (default) are available. If x axis is category axis, value can be category name. If x axis is timeseries axis, value can be date string, Date object and unixtime integer.
properties.name: x.lines

properties.description: Show grids along x axis.
properties.name: y.show

properties.description:
Show additional grid lines along y axis.
This option accepts array including object that has value, text, position and class.
properties.name: y.lines

properties.description: Show grids when focus.
properties.name: focus.show

name: point
description: Set point options
examples: point: {     show: false,     r: 5,     focus: {         expand: {             enabled: true,             r: 1         }     },     select: {         r: 3     } }

properties.description: Whether to show each point in line.
properties.name: point.show

properties.description: The radius size of each point.
properties.name: point.r

properties.description: Whether to expand each point on focus.
properties.name: point.focus.expand.enabled

properties.description: The radius size of each point on focus.
properties.name: point.focus.expand.r

properties.description: The radius size of each point on selected.
properties.name: point.select.r

name: line
description: Set line options

properties.description:
Set if null data point will be connected or not.
If true set, the region of null data will be connected without any data point. If false set, the region of null data will not be connected and get empty.
properties.name: line.connectNull

properties.description:
Change step type for step chart.
**Available values:** - step - step-before - step-after
properties.name: line.step_type

name: bar
description: Set bar options
examples: bar: {     width: 10,     // or     width: {         ratio: 0.2,         max: 200     },     zerobased: false }

properties.description: Change the width of bar chart.
properties.name: bar.width

properties.description: Change the width of bar chart by ratio.
properties.name: bar.width.ratio

properties.description: Set if min or max value will be 0 on bar chart.
properties.name: bar.zerobased

name: area
description: Set area options

properties.description: Set if min or max value will be 0 on area chart.
properties.name: area.zerobased

name: pie
description: Set pie options
examples: pie: {     label: {         show: false,         format: function(value, ratio, id) {             return d3.format("$")(value);         },         threshold: 0.1     },     expand: false,     padAngle: 0.1 }

properties.description: Show or hide label on each pie piece.
properties.name: pie.label.show

properties.description: Set formatter for the label on each pie piece.
properties.name: pie.label.format

properties.description: Set threshold to show/hide labels.
properties.name: pie.label.threshold

properties.description: Enable or disable expanding pie pieces.
properties.name: pie.expand

properties.description: Set padding between data.
properties.name: pie.padAngle

name: gauge
description: Set gauge options
examples: gauge: {     label: {         show: false,         format: function(value, ratio) {             return value;         }     },     expand: false,     min: -100,     max: 200,     units: "%",     width: 10 }

properties.description: Show or hide label on gauge.
properties.name: gauge.label.show

properties.description: Set formatter for the label on gauge.
properties.name: gauge.label.format

properties.description: Enable or disable expanding gauge.
properties.name: gauge.expand

properties.description: Set min value of the gauge.
properties.name: gauge.min

properties.description: Set max value of the gauge.
properties.name: gauge.max

properties.description: Set units of the gauge.
properties.name: gauge.units

properties.description: Set width of gauge chart.
properties.name: gauge.width

name: donut
description: Set donut options
examples: donut: {     label: {         show: false,         format: function(value, ratio, id) {             return d3.format("$")(value);         },         threshold: 0.1     },     expand: false,     width: 10,     title: "Donut Title",     padAngle: 0.2 }

properties.description: Show or hide label on each donut piece.
properties.name: donut.label.show

properties.description: Set formatter for the label on each donut piece.
properties.name: donut.label.format

properties.description: Set threshold to show/hide labels.
properties.name: donut.label.threshold

properties.description: Enable or disable expanding donut pieces.
properties.name: donut.expand

properties.description: Set width of donut chart.
properties.name: donut.width

properties.description: Set title of donut chart.
properties.name: donut.title

properties.description: Set padding between data.
properties.name: donut.padAngle

name: spline
description: Set spline options

name: regions
description:
Show rectangles inside the chart.

This option accepts array including object that has axis, start, end and class. The keys start, end and class are optional. axis must be x, y or y2. start and end should be the value where regions start and end. If not specified, the edge values will be used. If timeseries x axis, date string, Date object and unixtime integer can be used. If class is set, the region element will have it as class.

name: tooltip
description: Tooltip options
examples: tooltip: {     show: true,     grouped: false,     format: {         title: function(x) { return "Data " + x; },         name: function(name, ratio, id, index) { return name; },         value: function(value, ratio, id, index) { return ratio; }     },     position: function(data, width, height, element) {         return {top: 0, left: 0}     },     contents: function(d, defaultTitleFormat, defaultValueFormat, color) {         return ... // formatted html as you want     } }

properties.description: Show or hide tooltip.
properties.name: tooltip.show

properties.description: Set if tooltip is grouped or not for the data points.
properties.name: tooltip.grouped

properties.description:
Set format for the title of tooltip.
Specified function receives x of the data point to show.
properties.name: tooltip.format.title

properties.description:
Set format for the name of each data in tooltip.
Specified function receives name, ratio, id and index of the data point to show. ratio will be undefined if the chart is not donut/pie/gauge.
properties.name: tooltip.format.name

properties.description:
Set format for the value of each data in tooltip.
Specified function receives name, ratio, id and index of the data point to show. ratio will be undefined if the chart is not donut/pie/gauge. If undefined returned, the row of that value will be skipped.
properties.name: tooltip.format.value

properties.description:
Set custom position for the tooltip.
This option can be used to modify the tooltip position by returning object that has top and left.
properties.name: tooltip.position

properties.description:
Set custom HTML for the tooltip.
Specified function receives data, defaultTitleFormat, defaultValueFormat and color of the data point to show. If tooltip.grouped is true, data includes multiple data points.
properties.name: tooltip.contents

name: title
description: Set title options
examples: title: {     text: "Title Text",     padding: {         top: 10,         right: 10,         bottom: 10,         left: 10     },     position: "top-center" }
